meanings.definition: To make something dull or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: She kept drabbing the painting until all the colors faded away.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather was drabbing the mood of the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his boring stories were drabbing the audience to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous routine was slowly drabbing the excitement out of her life.
meanings.sent5: The gray clouds drabbing the sky made everything seem gloomy.

meanings.definition: The act of making something dull or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: Her constant drabbing of the room's decor made it look lifeless.
meanings.sent2: The drabbing of the movie script left the audience yawning.
meanings.sent3: The drabbing of the party theme made it seem like a snooze fest.
meanings.sent4: The drabbing of the conversation drained all the excitement from the room.
meanings.sent5: The drabbing of the presentation turned what could have been interesting into a bore.
